ratings.comment: I loved 363. While it will always be difficult to maintain attention in an online lecture, the concepts were interesting and Professor Steinberg offered great explanations. Also enjoyed the application of theories with the interview project. Really fair grading for exams and the paper if you do the readings and watch lectures- not too much to ask

while the material is interesting for most of the lectures, her voice gets irritating. do not wait until last minute to watch the lectures! if you don't read the book and watch the lectures, you probably won't do well. exams are tricky with specific material that was not covered. i managed to get an A but had to work hard.
She really has a passion for her class and wants everyone to do well. Interesting topics, but not the best class I've ever taken. Pretty easy to get an A/AB.

Easy course. I didn't listen to the video. I just used all the powerpoint notes for studying. Get an average grade for all exams. Paper grade improves it. Read the terms on the textbook. Because I spent so little time in this course and just cram before exam, I'll say it's a easy course if you don't like to study everyday.

I really enjoyed this class! Going to the reviews will make your grade. She basically reviews everything she'll want you to know for the exam. She's very personable and approachable. Watching the lectures gets boring, but you'll have that with any online class.

booooring.  i just used the powerpoints for notes.  she definitely could ease up on the exams...too many specific things from the book that were barely mentioned came up on the exams, and although i used all the study materials she provided, i still did poorly.  don't take it

A relatively easy class, that i could understand and follow. I thought i would get an A going into all the exams, but she made them harder than necessary. Assignments bring up the grade which is good. She is relatively clear, but lists too much information on slides. I would recommend reading the book.

I disliked Jill for 363 as well (mostly because she bothered me while I watched the online lectures) but trust me, she is much more laid back in person and she sure loves her job and knows what she is talking about.

Didn't really like this class. She reads from the powerpoints, and she just didn't seems that clear to me. The exams were also tougher than I thought. Make sure you know the lecture notes and book info inside and out. However, if you have a problem with something, she is very understanding and helpful.

Information given in lectures often conflicted with more reputable sources (such as the DSM IV) and other courses. She refused to address questions. Many of the concepts she presented as fact were her opinion and were not stated as such. It was very interesting subject matter, an easy course, but the professor was terrible.
DOESN'T KNOW HOW TO SPEAK WELL!! Reads off of power points (boring)... and is TOO nitpicky in with the exams. It is general stuff and easy to learn concepts, she makes it a lot harder thena it is...
The exams and papers were ridiculous. Try and make it to class, otherwise just think it though...it's not like all weren't in adolescence a few years ago. Check out her outfits too!
exams are fair...just watch the lectures and SKIM the book
Does much better with teaching upper-level classes. We played or made up games during class, does lecture of powerpoints, which can get boring, but breaks it up well.
VERY boring and tests are very nitpiky. She speaks in monotone and doesn't seem comfortable. Kind of hard to watch.
tests were hard, lecture was boring
Reads off powerpoints, gets lost in her notes often
prof is nice.  363 is an easy class
